meanings.definition: A large quantity or number of something.
meanings.sent1: She had dauds of toys scattered across the floor.
meanings.sent2: The store had dauds of colorful balloons for sale.
meanings.sent3: The dauds of confetti at the party made a mess but added to the fun.
meanings.sent4: The dauds of stars in the night sky twinkled brightly.
meanings.sent5: The dauds of leaves falling in autumn painted the ground in shades of red and gold.

meanings.definition: To strike or beat someone or something.
meanings.sent1: He dauds the drum with great enthusiasm during the performance.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith would dauds the metal to shape it into tools.
meanings.sent3: The chef would dauds the dough to make the perfect bread.
meanings.sent4: The waves daud against the shore, creating a soothing sound.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter would daud the nails into the wood to build a sturdy table.

meanings.sent1: The thunderstorm outside produced dauds of thunder that shook the windows.
meanings.sent2: The firecrackers made loud dauds that echoed through the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected dauds of laughter from the audience interrupted the serious play.
meanings.sent4: The dauds of fireworks lit up the night sky with bursts of color.
meanings.sent5: The dauds of the marching band could be heard from far away during the parade.
